info.name: Setup Elasticsearch Index
info.description: Flow configures Elasticsearch Index (Mappings, ILM and Rollup)
info.author: support@axway.com

indexName.description: The name of the index used as a prefix to name required ES config assets.

parameters.name: disableCustomProperties
parameters.metaDescription: Convience flag to disable loading of custom properties. This may be set by a configuration toggle.

parameters.name: name
parameters.metaDescription: Name of the legacy index template.

parameters.name: customProperties
parameters.metaDescription: The custom properties as they have been loaded from the API-Manager

parameters.name: desiredIndexTemplate
parameters.metaDescription: The desired Elasticsearch index template containing the mappings.

parameters.name: actualIndexTemplate
parameters.metaDescription: The actual Index-Template mapping loaded from Elasticsearch used to compare if new custom properties have been added. If all custom properties are already part of the mapping, the noUpdate exit is used.

parameters.name: customPropertiesSettings
parameters.metaDescription: Controls if and how custom properties should be merged into the index template. See config file: elasticsearch_config/index_config.json

parameters.name: eventLogCustomProperties
parameters.metaDescription: The EventLog custom properties which are configured using the parameter EVENTLOG_CUSTOM_ATTR. If given, they will be additionally merged into the index template.

parameters.name: updateWhenChanged
parameters.metaDescription: If true, the flow-node load the existing template and if present, the version is compared. Only if the version of the given template is higher, the existing template will be updated. If there is no existing template a new template is created.

parameters.name: recreate
parameters.metaDescription: If true, the index template is always updated.

parameters.name: body
parameters.metaDescription: The template definition.

parameters.name: name
parameters.metaDescription: Name of the legacy index template.

parameters.name: parseJson
parameters.metaDescription: Turn this option if you are reading s JSON-File and would like to parse it into a JS-Object.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.metaDescription: The filename to read.

parameters.name: parseJson
parameters.metaDescription: Turn this option if you are reading s JSON-File and would like to parse it into a JS-Object.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.metaDescription: The filename to read.

parameters.name: body
parameters.metaDescription: The lifecycle policy definition to register

parameters.name: updateWhenChanged
parameters.metaDescription: If set, the specified ILM policy and the ILM policy in Elasticsearch are compared and only updated if they are different. Note, that the ILM-Policy returned from Elasticsearch may contain default values. These defaults must be part of you desired ILM Policy. If the ILM policy does not exist in Elasticsearch, the ILM policy is created.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.metaDescription: The name of the index lifecycle policy

parameters.name: attachToIndexTemplate
parameters.metaDescription: If specified, the created/updated ILM policy is assigned to one more index templates. Index template names specified as a comma-separated list, each may contain an rollover alias. E.g. template1:aliasName1, template2

parameters.name: parseJson
parameters.metaDescription: Turn this option if you are reading s JSON-File and would like to parse it into a JS-Object.

parameters.name: notFoundFails
parameters.metaDescription: Set this flag, if you would like to have this flow node failed (Error) if the file cannot be found.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.metaDescription: The filename to read.

parameters.name: alias
parameters.metaDescription: Name of the existing index alias or data stream on which to the perform the rollover. Can be a string or an object. (e.g. { "my-rollover-alias": {} }). Only one alias is supported.

parameters.name: wildcardAlias
parameters.metaDescription: Given alias is considered as a prefix. All indicies starting with the alias, will be rolled up.

parameters.name: data
parameters.metaDescription: The value to assign to the "data" variable in the template.

parameters.name: template
parameters.metaDescription: The Mustache template. e.g. `Hi {{data.user}}`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.metaDescription: Object that contains either the property indexName or params.indexName.

parameters.name: indexConfigs
parameters.metaDescription: Object that contains all index configurations

parameters.name: status
parameters.metaDescription: The HTTP status code

parameters.name: body
parameters.metaDescription: The response payload

parameters.name: status
parameters.metaDescription: The HTTP status code

parameters.name: body
parameters.metaDescription: The response payload

parameters.name: status
parameters.metaDescription: The HTTP status code

parameters.name: body
parameters.metaDescription: The response payload

parameters.name: value
parameters.metaDescription: The value to test input against.

parameters.name: source
parameters.metaDescription: The input to test.

parameters.name: data
parameters.metaDescription: The value to apply as the `data` argument of the JavaScript code. For objects and arrays, `data` is passed by reference.

parameters.name: code
parameters.metaDescription: A JavaScript function body. Supports `await` and returning promises. `data` is the value of the Data parameter. `logger` is the API Builder logger. See the docs for more info: https://docs.axway.com/bundle/api-builder/page/docs/developer_guide/flows/flow_nodes/javascript_flow_node/index.html

parameters.name: skipInDevelopment
parameters.metaDescription: If set to true, the API-Builder process will not be stopped, when in development mode. Instead only the errorCode and errorMessage is logged.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.metaDescription: An optional message which is logged when the process is terminated. Helpful to make clear the reason for the shutdown.

parameters.name: errorCode
parameters.metaDescription: An integer number used for the process to exit. Defaults to -1.

parameters.name: errorCode
parameters.metaDescription: An integer number used for the process to exit. Defaults to -1.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.metaDescription: An optional message which is logged when the process is terminated. Helpful to make clear the reason for the shutdown.

parameters.name: skipInDevelopment
parameters.metaDescription: If set to true, the API-Builder process will not be stopped, when in development mode. Instead only the errorCode and errorMessage is logged.

parameters.name: ilmConfig
parameters.metaDescription: The ILM Config object that is supposed to be send to Elasticsearch to create or update the ILM-Policy. It is read from the $.indexConfig.ilm.config file and converted into an object.

parameters.name: indexConfig
parameters.metaDescription: Index configuration as defined in elasticsearch_config/index_config.json. It also contains the index name.

parameters.name: rententionPeriodConfig
parameters.metaDescription: Contains the path of the retention period config file. If not given, the standard ILM is used.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.metaDescription: The filename to read.

parameters.name: parseJson
parameters.metaDescription: Turn this option if you are reading s JSON-File and would like to parse it into a JS-Object.

parameters.name: source
parameters.metaDescription: The input to test.

parameters.name: value
parameters.metaDescription: The value to test input against.

parameters.name: level
parameters.metaDescription: The desired log level of the output logs.

parameters.name: message
parameters.metaDescription: The log message.
